page.syntax: Result_String as C = UI_GET_NUMBER(C title,C prompt[,C default_choice[,C format_string]])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: prompt
argument.description: The descriptive text above the data entry field.

argument.name: default_choice
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The number text that will be in the Number text box when the dialog box first appears.

argument.name: format_string
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". To force the entered number to follow a specific format, supply the optional Format String parameter. The format string is a sequence of special characters that dictates how you are to enter a valid text string.

item.name: N
item.description: Any upper letter, digit, sign or decimal

item.name: n
item.description: Any letter, digit, sign or decimal

page.discussion: UI_GET_NUMBER() creates and displays a dialog box containing a number field. The number that you enter or change is returned as a Result String. This function is useful for obtaining a number value that conforms to a specified format. Use the VAL()function on the Result_String to get the number.

section.description: The Result_String will be empty ("") if the Cancel button is selected. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script plays a guessing game. The computer picks a random number from 0 to 100 and the user tries to guess it.
section.example: user_number = -1 secret_number = int(rand() *100) while user_number <> secret_number user_number = val(ui_get_number("Game","What is your guess? (0-100)","0","000")) if user_number > secret_number then ui_msg_box("Game", "That number is too big.") elseif user_number < secret_number then ui_msg_box("Game", "That number is too small.") end if end while ui_beep() ui_msg_box("Game","Congratulations! The number is:" + str(secret_number))
